thread.title: Ride the rails to shopping and scenery in Connecticut
thread.title_full: Ride the rails to shopping and scenery in Connecticut

title: Ride the rails to shopping and scenery in Connecticut
locations: Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park
text: Ride the rails to shopping and scenery in Connecticut The Fall Foliage and Shopping Excursion train tour travels from Woonsocket to Putnam, Connecticut, for a pumpkin festival, antiquing and dining. Comment Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 12:01 AM Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 12:01 AM WOONSOCKET, R.I. -- The Blackstone Valley Tourism Council will once again present its annual Fall Foliage and Shopping Excursion train tour. On Saturday, Oct. 24, board a Providence & Worcester Railroad train at Woonsocket Depot and head for Putnam, Connecticut, where visitors can take part in the Great Pumpkin Festival. Travel along the rails and take in the peak autumn colors and scenes in the new Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park. Plus, see the rustic nature and beauty of the Quinebaug & Shetucket Rivers Valley National Corridor, known for its stretches of greenery, rolling hills and classic New England look. The tour includes a 3Â½-hour stop in Putnam for antiques shopping, dining and the pumpkin festival. There will also be an arts and crafts fair, music, sidewalk sales and the Fall Bazaar and luncheon at the Putnam Congregational Church. The train will leave from the Woonsocket Train Depot, One Depot Square, at 9 a.m., and arrives back in Woonsocket at 4:30 p.m. Tickets, which start at $29.50, can be purchased online at bit.ly/1hp1ws3 . For more information, call (401) 495-1213 or visit tourblackstone.com . providencejournal.com
